5.description: I am a very, very PICKY person when it comes to my eyebrows.  I check, double check and re- check when I get them done.  I found Nikki at the Orland Square Mall over 7 years ago.  I found out she left and tracked her down at Sizzor Trix.  I drive 25 minutes out of my way just to have her do my brows.  She is OUTSTANDING.  Again, I can be a pain in the a$$ as a customer because my brows are everything to me-with Nikki, I have a seat and relax.  She knows what I like and is very efficient.  She does not rush you even if 5 other girls are waiting.  She went on vacation for a month, no one touched my brows, hell I looked like a man but it was worth the wait...lol.               Go and see Nikki-she will transform you! Remember your brows are a frame for your face!

25.description: I came here initially because I purchased a Groupon Now deal for eyebrow threading.  I will continue to come back because I agree that Niki does an awesome job.  She pointed out that due to past threading done incorrectly, my eyebrows didn't match in my arch area.  As I looked closer, she was right.  Thankfully she was able to fix this issue and I have been getting a lot of compliments on my eyebrows.  I like this place better than the Chicago Ridge or Orland mall.  It's closer to my house, cheaper, and Niki offers a free threading after 5 visits.  If you are in the area, check it out!

12.description: Nikki is the best. I can't go to another threader or my eyebrows will look a hot mess. she does a great job.

21.description: I arrived there about 10:30am on a Monday. Only niki was there and when I asked for a haircut, she politely asked me to wait and she went out to the dollar store next door. A man came in, niki was still gone and he asked me if I wanted a haircut to which I said sure.I had showered and washed my hair before going there. He started cutting my hair and made a lot of comments to it: losing hair, dry scalp, whoever cut my hair last did a bad job. He also knocked off competitions like hair current and the brow bar at Chicago ridge. The convo was pretty awkward. And he charged me $15. I asked about the sign that said $8.99, he said that's for kids even tho I did not see "kids" anywhere on the sign. And I asked for an inch off and I think he cut more than that. But it's ok. I can work w it.I had the groupon for the $6 threading. The man left and niki came back. At first she told me to come back a week bc I had baby hairs. Then she offered to brush it up for me since I bought the groupon already. She did a good job w my brows, and it's painless compared to my experiences w other places.The Internet was out at the time and I didn't have cash so she and the man had to keep running to the store next door to charge. And as it turned out, the haircut should've been $10 not $15, bc the guy thought niki had washed my hair hence the extra $5 charged. But it evened out since there was some groupon complications and Internet complications that prevented me from paying any more for the brows.I would've given 3 for the haircut and the guy but niki was very nice and accommodating and fair so hence the extra star.$8 brows, $5 brows on mon and tues$10 adult haircut$15 adult haircut and wash$8.99 "kids haircut" I still don't know how much they charge for pedi's, mani's. There were signs w different prices so it was confusing and a bit frustrating.Anyway, just ask for niki and bring cash in case their internet is out again. And probably best to come in the afternoon and not morning since only one person is in the store.

16.description: I arrived there about 10:30am on a Monday. Only niki was there and when I asked for a haircut, she politely asked me to wait and she went out to the dollar store next door. A man came in, niki was still gone and he asked me if I wanted a haircut to which I said sure.I had showered and washed my hair before going there. He started cutting my hair and made a lot of comments to it: losing hair, dry scalp, whoever cut my hair last did a bad job. He also knocked off competitions like hair current and the brow bar at Chicago ridge. The convo was pretty awkward. And he charged me $15. I asked about the sign that said $8.99, he said that's for kids even tho I did not see "kids" anywhere on the sign. And I asked for an inch off and I think he cut more than that. But it's ok. I can work w it.I had the groupon for the $6 threading. The man left and niki came back. At first she told me to come back a week bc I had baby hairs. Then she offered to brush it up for me since I bought the groupon already. She did a good job w my brows, and it's painless compared to my experiences w other places.The Internet was out at the time and I didn't have cash so she and the man had to keep running to the store next door to charge. And as it turned out, the haircut should've been $10 not $15, bc the guy thought niki had washed my hair hence the extra $5 charged. But it evened out since there was some groupon complications and Internet complications that prevented me from paying any more for the brows.I would've given 3 for the haircut and the guy but niki was very nice and accommodating and fair so hence the extra star.$8 brows, $5 brows on mon and tues$10 adult haircut$15 adult haircut and wash$8.99 "kids haircut" I still don't know how much they charge for pedi's, mani's. There were signs w different prices so it was confusing and a bit frustrating.Anyway, just ask for niki and bring cash in case their internet is out again. And probably best to come in the afternoon and not morning since only one person is in the store.

17.description: I had the same experience with the male "stylist"! He asked who cut my hair before and knocked them, told me my hair was falling out, then 5 minutes later told me I had healthy hair. He also mentioned that he is a full time student, owns and manages the dollar store next door, and sells cars, all while he's a hair dresser?! I asked for a long bob, a very simple cut I imagine, and one side of my hair is a long bob with some layers, but the other side has some short and some long layers that go in a diagonal down the side of y head. Not a good look. So so disappointed. And they charged me $25 for my hair cut and wash, but he didn't ask if I wanted a blow dry so I couldn't tell how ridiculous I looked! I'm going to stick with Studio K, same price, excellent service, and great at what they do! And only a little over a mile away!

10.description: Had a bad wax with a salon so I grew my eyebrows for a few months and decided to go to Niki. She took her time with my eyebrows and explained the threading and tinting process really well. Will definitely be back!!!

11.description: I wanted to switch up where I usually get my brows done because they were getting too busy.This place very close to where I live and Yelpers gave it favorable reviews. Niki did a great job, and it wasn't overly painful. My eyebrows were evenly done (which has been difficult for some to accomplish since I have a permanent scar under one of them).Monday and Tuesday is $5 (cash only; they charge an extra dollar if you utilize plastic); $8 dollars the remainder of the week.I would recommend this place to anyone who needs a good eyebrow threading.

26.description: I go here for Threading the place is great It's warm & inviting from the moment you step inside Niki is the owner and will take care or your every threading need. She is a perfectionist and focuses on your every unwanted hair. I like to call her a eyebrow stylist. Her shop has a full service salon from mani / pedi, even hair stylist . She services every client.... Men& Women she is located right on the corner of 127th and Pulaski in Alsip. It's  better than any mall threading place. You can also have privacy while getting your needs met your not sitting in the middle of the mall for everyone to see. I suggest Sizzor Trix for your every need

27.description: I went here to use a Groupon I purchased for a mani/pedi. The place was great, so was the service! My hands and feet looked great and the girl that did my nails was really sweet! The only reason I didn't give a five-star review is because no nail clippers were used at all, especially on my toes, she just used a nail file.

0.description: Niki is a brow guru!I've been a customer of hers for about 3 years already. I heard of her from word-of-mouth. I'm so happy I found Niki! She's detailed and knows about shaping and cleaning up your eyebrows. Eyebrow threading is $5 on Monday and Tuesday (cash only), but I don't mind paying regular price of $8 when I have to see her on the weekend. She's the best.

20.description: I found out about Sizzor Trix by purchasing a Groupon Now deal for an eyebrow threading. Nikki did a FANTASTIC job! This was the first time getting my brows done via the threading method and I like it a lot better than the wax. I did have some slight irritation probably because this was a new method for me, but it went away after about 10 minutes. It only took about 10 minutes for her to thread both brows and I must say that I was very impressed by the outcome. I usually go up north to get my brows waxed and pay over $20, but I will definitely be coming back to Nikki. She has a customer for life.

19.description: I live in the vacinity of Sizzor Trix and passed the location on a daily basis, I used to go to another threading establishment but everytime I went I got a different person.  Nikki did my brows and i LOVE them, they are great and I have been back twice since my initial visit.  Would highly recommend Sizzor Trix.

2.description: I usually come to NIkki, but she's not there at opening or during 6:30 to closing time. There's another lady who works there; ive never gotten her name. She does an okay job. Even though your eyebrows aren't supposed to be twins theyre more like sisters. Mines aren't even close to being sisters. Her eyebrow tinting is weird? The lady went over my eyebrow and ontop of the skin. it was so thick. I'd come back just for Nikki.

18.description: My unibrow has been in need of some care for a while and I kept putting off going to get them done because I hadn't really been happy with the previous results from the many shops I had visited.  I was waiting to place a carry out order in a restaurant and noticed how great the eyebrows of the person taking orders looked.  When I placed my order, I also asked her where she got her eyebrows done, to which she replied, 'In Alsip, I get them threaded".  I didn't want to hold up the other orders so I didn't ask for more specific information.  I check the internet for eyebrow threading in Alsip, IL.  and I came across one shop, Sizzor Trix!  The shop is conveniently located in a strip mall just west of Pulaski on 127th street.I read the reviews and was excited to go see Niki.  I was not disappointed...Niki quickly (less than 10 minutes) took care of my unibrow and quite beautifully.  I took one look in the mirror and realized I had found my new ebrow home!  My brows were beautifully arched and look very natural.  As stated in one of the other reviews, there was a tiny bit of discomfort, but well worth it (nothing like the discomfort I sometimes experienced the next day after getting my brows waxed...and let's not even discuss the pain of plucking)!  Go see Niki at Sizzor Trix in Alsip, IL  you won't be disappointed!

13.description: I went on a Friday and there was no wait. She was pretty quick and did a great job. My brows were last done with a razor which caused them to grow back funny. She did a great job shaping and helping them to look natural again. I'll definitely be back!

4.description: I visited the salon because of a Living Social deal and was quite impressed with the service that I received.  Nikki is great and she is indeed all of the good things that everyone on the site has raved about.  I am very picky about my eyebrows and she did an excellent job.  She's also friendly and personable!  If you're on the far southwest side of Chicago (Alsip) - she's definitely worth giving a try!

24.description: I used to go to Nikki for eyebrow threading when she worked at Orland Mall. It wasn't strange for there to be a long line of women just waiting for Nikki. I kid you not, this woman is TALENTED, and I have never, ever been disappointed in the work she has done on me. One day, I discovered she was no longer working at Orland Mall and had no idea where she went. I was offered $5 off on my first Groupon Now! purchase and noticed that I would only pay $1 to get my eyebrows threaded at Sizzor Trix. I obviously bought it, and who was the threading artist? NIKKI! I'm so glad I finally found her. She does Groupon Now!s pretty often I believe, and they are $6 as opposed to $8 (I think). I believe she has $5 deals on Mondays and Tuesdays, and Nikki also has a frequent customer card where you will get your fifth or sixth eyebrow threading free. Please, please go to her if you want beautiful eyebrows done inexpensively! You won't be disappointed!

6.description: Awesome! I've tried many other establishments that were not consistent with the work. This place rocks very friendly, and professional. On a scale 1 to 10 this place gets a big 10. BEST EYEBROW THREADING IN THE SOUTH SUBURBS EVER!!!

22.description: I desperately needed to get my eyebrows done and came across an offer for this place on Groupon.  I decided to give it a try and my experience was awesome!  The lady who did my eyebrows, Niki, was very professional and expedient.  My wait time was very short, the salon had an inviting ambiance, and everything was arranged nicely.  I don't live anywhere near this establishment as I stay in the city; however, it was truly worth the trip and will be returning.  Not only that, Niki gave me a demonstration on her  nails of how the "crackled" nail polish works - amazed I was, so I purchased a bottle for myself.  I highly recommend this place!!

15.description: I am so happy that I have found someplace to get my threading done!  It's on the way home and they have specials.  This is something I can keep up without traveling out my way.  The young lady Nikki that took care of me was very gentle and quick! This is my new hot spot!!!

7.description: My first time coming here and nikki was very pleasant and she did a really good job considering the fact I don't trust many people to do my eyebrows. I will be coming back!!!!

8.description: My wife asked me to post a review on this place.She loves it.  She goes here to get her eyebrows done.  They take a string and start rubbing it all over her forehead........I don't know.  Whatever they're doing, she thinks they're great.They have special prices on Mondays and Tuedays.

3.description: Went here based off of positive reviews...Not good at all. Eyebrows were crooked and over threaded. I had taken me eight weeks for my eyebrows grow in just to have them messed up.

14.description: I swear never going anywhere else. My eyebrows look amazing!

1.description: This place is a cute little place. They have a bar next door. I definitely prefer this place to olive garden. The portions are huge. Its by my house so its convenient. Entrees are no more than $15.

0.description: I live in South Chicago and Roma's has been around for a long time. We recently went and had a good experience. I had the fettuccini Alfredo and the portion was massive. My mom had the lemon chicken and enjoyed it. Overall food was good and service was decent. The bar is connected to the restaurant and I could hear the Bears getting their ass kicked, besides being a Bears fan everything else was great.

cheapest price In Chicago,  counseled me in a very patient friendly and respectful manner,  faster service, they have expertise diabetic & HIV medication,  i would always prefer this location for medication.

1.description: The big girl at the register was lost and didn't know how to ring up a coupon. Train them Popeyes.

2.description: Wish I can rate a negative star here

0.description: By the name of the restaurant, Popeyes Chicken, you'd think that chicken would be readily available.  Not so.  At 6pm on a (football) Sunday, I got in line at the drive thru with one car ahead of me at the order menu board and waited 8 minutes. The person before me was waiting to for them to be ready to take his order.  When it was my turn, I started to place my order only to be told, "All chicken orders will be a 15 minute wait". What?!?  I didn't ask for a specialty item off the menu, I asked for chicken from Popeyes Chicken.  The reason for the one star on this review is more for the person who designed the parking lot that allowed me to quickly get out of line and head to KFC on 95th/Stony where the service was friendly, my food was hot and fresh, and my order was right. Whoever does the inspections/evaluations at this Popeyes, new management is sorely needed.  It would serve you well to emulate your operations after a franchise that has a working model. If you can't deliver on your core competency, what good are you?

1.description: They NEVER have ice cream!

2.description: Went here once. It's crowded around 2pm until. The bathrooms are so nasty. They put no money into them..everything was broken down.I went there months ago, and a friend told me it was the same way she went there. Besides that the food is okay. They get 1 star for the food. the other 4 are blank because every restaurant should have working bathrooms.

0.description: This location has undergone some work and it is clean - clearly improved since the earlier reviews were written.  We live nearby and this is the "after-daycare-only-if-you-were-good" treat location.  This location always seems to have fresh fries, a well-coordinated drive-thru (even though its only one lane) and friendly drive thru staff.  Keep up the great work!

3.description: By far, the most disgusting coffee I've EVER had and Dunkin' Donuts coffee is my absolute fav! I'll get back to the coffee in a sec but let me start with the poor set-up of this location.  The store's drive-thru is so awkwardly designed that if more than 2 cars are in the drive-thru then the remaining cars are dangerously in a holding pattern on Stoney Island, one of the busiest streets in Chicago.  I was in the drive-thru line for almost 10 minutes and there were only 3 cars in front of me.  Back to the coffee...I ordered a medium hazelnut coffee extra, extra.  I order the same thing every time I got to DD and it always come out perfectly until today.  There was WAY too much hazelnut flavoring to the point where I couldn't even drink it.  It was entirely too sweet and I actually like my coffee sweet.  There was no number on the receipt or online anywhere to call about the issue.  If I wasn't on my way to work I would've turned right back around and had them remake it but that would've made me late.The only positive that I can speak on is the person taking my order was very polite.

1.description: Blasting the radio at any business is not good unless you a Night Club.  Some employees seem great, but others not so much. Sometimes it's a little messy.

2.description: There is always some form of entertainment standing outside of this establishment.  The donuts are smaller than most and the coffee isn't the greatest but the hood entertainment is the best,  the guy with the stick om his foot attached to the beach bottle and pill bottle morraccas is the best.....I never tip cash though, just good advice lmao

0.description: I came here to get a scoop of ice cream to go on top of a funnel cake from Checkers but when I saw that the kids cone was 2.09 I left.The place was the clean and the cashiers were nice and said they understood even if they didn't but I couldn't pay that price when I could get ice cream from McDonalds for .49 cent.Enjoy!

4.description: Nothing but location brings me to this place. What kind of coffee shop does not offer wifi? This one. I went to ask about it, and no employee knew how to access it. No one in the store. Other times, they were out of advertised products but, kept the signs up anyway, clearly to get people in the store. These little place are all over, I would suggest finding another or moving on to another brand.

1.description: When I first went to this Harold's I praised it, told all my friends about it (well I still will but for a different reason) I even thought it was one of the best Harold's in town. If I could give this Harold's a minus 0 star I would and that would be generous after the experience I had last night!Back to the review...my feeling regarding this Harold's has all changed...why do you ask well let me tell you!  First when we got home my girlfriend was missing one piece of 6 piece chicken dinner.  Now I know that can happen but the customer service was horrid because the lady on the other end of the phone kept saying baby and she was more lax then she was business in my opinion. Now would that be a reason I tell you that I'm given this Harold's 1 star of course not it was the tasteless overcooked chicken and hard fries that tasted more like old grease.I got the 4 piece mix which includes the breast,wing, leg, and thigh.  I received a mini leg which I will be uploading the picture and trust me when I say this leg was smaller than a ball point pen...sheeesh!  The thigh which I didn't eat was hard like a rock, the breast was flavorless but the meat was juicy but by the time I got to the bone I was mortified to see red, so needless to say I threw the rest of it away!Now I don't know if Howard McGee still owns this place or if they have a new manager but what I do know is the food is not worth the overpriced chicken and the food is some of the most unsatisfying food I have ever tasted... I wouldn't even feed it to my dog!The green beans along with their red beans and rice are in the cooler which I assume they warm up in the microwave...how fresh is that I can't tell you, but what I can tell you is go at your own risk because if you go in hungry you will still be hungry because the food is less than desirable.I don't even believe it is worth going to get the one wing that is owed to us because we may just end up throwing it away!Hey Howard you truly need to either take your name off the business or start making sure the business with your name on it stands for quality service, quality food, and quality standards because right now it has not  met  any of those qualities and I won't be back nor will I recommend your establishment too friends or family!

2.description: If you have a choose in what Harolds you eat at do not choose this one. The young lady that works in the window and answering the phones has the worst attitude ever. We work near there and now everyone at our job refuses to go there now. It's suprising that the radio personality owns this place and lets a rude individual work there. And now it states that everything is being recorded that is said in the lobby, I wonder do they actually do that because they would hear how ignorant that worker is.

0.description: Classic Harolds.

1.description: Mr.  Twist is absolutely awesome. He is passionate about his craft and a consummate professional.

0.description: The review is well past due. I just finished with an awesome mani and pedi "extended stay". This is my second visit and I repeat the "extended stay" is definitely an experience! Don't slip on Mr. Twist, you won't be disappointed! Check him out!

3.description: This used to be a decent spot, but they've gone down considerably over time. The chicken is bland , the food is less, and the prices have gone up. Most recently, I ordered a half white. I'm expecting 2 WHOLE wings to be included. These jokers cut the drumettes off of both wings and threw it in there like that was okay. The way they ever so neatly packed it, you wouldn't have known that they were decapitated until you got home unless you ripped the whole thing open. If you end up here, hop on the e-way and go to the one on 87th & state street, or go north to 73rd & Stony for a better version of Harold's.

1.description: Terrible customer service. Food not as good as Dan Ryan. Don't go here. Waste of time and money.

2.description: They suck from food to service. I have tried several times to support them, but every experience has been worse and worse. I'll just take the trip to 86th and the Dan Ryan from now on.

5.description: [SHORT VERSION] Never again. Even when I love a product, I never give business to an establishment that cannot show basic respect and courtesy to it's customers.  If someone places an order, asks how long it will take and you say 20 minutes, that means 20 minutes. IT DOES NOT MEAN 1 HOUR AND 20 MINUTES. It does not mean deceive a customer multiple times about how long the wait will be without an apology and refusing to issue a refund; i.e. so the order can be cancelled.Stop advertising express pick up and learn basic customer service.  #CrazyHowardsHaroldsChicken @CrazyHowardMcGe[LONG VERSION] I called in my order and was told 20 minutes. I got to the location 25-30 minutes later and my food wasn't ready. I waited another 30-35 minutes before complaining. [Me] "Excuse me, when will my food be ready?"[Cashier] "They are wrapping it up now."(I wait another 10-15 minutes and ask about my food again. The cashier could tell I was annoyed, so she immediately had the manager come to speak with me.)[Me] "When is my food going to be ready?"[Manager] "They are fixing it now."[Me] "I want a refund."[Manager] "We don't do refunds."[Me] "Okay, I've been told twice the food was ready. Someone is waiting for me and needs to run an errand, I just need to know how long it will take."[Manager] "It's ready now.'[Me] "You just said they were still fixing it. Is it ready or is it still cooking?"[Manager] "It will be out in a moment."[Me] "I need a timeframe. How long will it actually take?"[Manager] "Two minutes."TEN minutes later, I start to walk up to the counter again to complain and they FINALLY call me for my food. As annoying as the wait was, I can understand them being busy. If they had told me an hour's wait  to begin with, I would have understood and come to pickup my food an hour later. Instead, I was misled multiple times with no respect nor regard for my time. On top of everything, at no point did I get an apology. Nothing at all.   Never again.

6.description: This is a good Harold's. The chicken was tasty and cooked to order. The prices were a little high to me but chicken has increased. You can call ahead or order through email. I will try this next time. It's clean and they have a parking lot in back. I'll return. The staff was courteous.

0.description: There pretty expensive. But the overall service is pretty good. Also a Tip! They don't take debit for delivery...

4.description: You can find a better harold's than this one that's for sure, their prices are very high compared to other facilities and if the service was great I wouldn't mind but it isn't. I called in an order and waited 40 additional minutes than the 20 i waited at home to go pick up my order. I called in to order another time and they told me they were out of french fries, what kind of chicken place doesn't have enough french fries? Go to another location if you get the chance.

3.description: Great Carmel Cake!!Perfection!

1.description: My last few treks (3 total) to the S-side to purchase baked goods have been disappointing.The butter cookies and 7-up based pound cake tasted odd. It seems as though all of the pound cakes are 7-up based, if I'm not mistaken, which is UGH!Cookies/Cake were thrown in the garbage, and for me to throw baked goods in the garbage, you better believe it was because my taste buds weren't feeling it :/I've had to return sweet potato pies in the past, because "something" just wasn't right :/I'm moving on, as there must be new amateur/unseasoned/unsupervised baker(s) in the kitchen that doesn't know what he/she is doing :/#QUALITYoverQUANTITY!

2.description: I'm at Angelica's on 87th, called yesterday and the lady told me it would be simple, just come in the same day and I could have caramel put on a pound cake. I just got here and I'm the only customer. I asked to have caramel put on a pound cake and the lady said I would have to leave this store and go to their Hazelcrest store. I told her the lady yesterday said I could have it done simply here. Well they charged me $28.98 and $5.00 extra for the caramel. That's ludicrous and I will never come here again. I will go to the north side where they make sense. This is ridiculous! I'm at 87th in Chicago and I am the ONLY CUSTOMER right nowand when I ask for caramel to be put on a pound cake I'm told to go to the Hazelcrest store. Folks get full of themselves when they get success and these people are ridiculous and wanted to argue with me.

5.description: It was just okay for me. I had banana pudding, a slice of cream cheese cake, and a double chocolate cupcake. The cupcake was dry and the frosting tasted like it came out of a can. Lots of variety here, though. They have  a lot of cake flavors as well as cookies, pies, and muffins. The prices are very reasonable and the staff was nice as well.

6.description: a Christan-based bakery?! With a caramel cake THIS GOOD?! Sign me up for Bible study, baby!! Angelica's Bakery isn't your average frou-frou bakery! They baked goods that taste like your Mom could have made it in her kitchen. No fancy french pastries or designer cupcakes! Just good ol' sheet cakes, slices of cake, peach cobbler, and assorted pies and cupcakes! Sounds plain but that's what make it's so special! They focus on ONE thing do right by it!Their caramel cake is IT!! A perfect balance of fluffy AND moist cake, with the most decadent caramel flavor frosting. Served up in thick slices that leave you wanting more!I think I'm gonna leave this review at that before it goes into "soft-core porn" category....lol...jk!Next time you're on the Southside, check this place out! Their staff is also super friendly!

0.description: I'm usually someone who eats cookies or donuts with their coffee in the morning, and I've never had a really bad sweet tooth. That is, until I was introduced to Angelica's!My goodness gracious, any time I am near this location or the one on 175th and Kedzie, I HAVE to buy something. The banana pudding is like Grandma's!

4.description: I hate going to a place and get ignored by one of the employees. I was the only one there. An older lady, maybe the owner, was busy w paper work and she finally acknowledged me. But the cashier was inattentive.  She didn't even say thanks for coming, but the owner did. Anyways...I ordered the oatmeal raisin and the pineapple coconut in a jar. The cookies were grainy as if it wasn't mixed well. The cake was ok. Nothing you couldn't get at ur local grocery store. I just wished it had more flavor. More chewiness to the cookies. More homemade flavor to the cake. It was an average place with subpar service.

3.description: Poor Management & Service!

1.description: Female Manager is horrible and ruined my night. She takes credit cards to the back with your id (which I think is weird), I gave her my passport id card and she wouldnt accept it although it had my picture and name to match my credit card. We argued at the bar and she insisted I go to her ATM and withdrawal the cash for the 22 dollar tab. How unexperienced and unprofessional! Only pay cash! A family member said once before additional money was taken from her account after paying with a CC there.  Just be cautious. The guy bartender was AWESOME. Food....only if you are drunk!

2.description: Looking for an evening of drinking, dancing and socializing on the southeast side of town, this is a nice place. The Dating Game New is foot steps away from Family Den lounge, which is a bonus!  Music is good, bartender is nice. The security makes you feel welcomed/VIP!

0.description: This was a trendy mid-scale social lounge my co-worker took me to. It had great music. Crowded.I would go again and highly recommend it.O, no cover fee.

4.description: well the dating game is free and you can  wear whatever you like. i have been here on wednesday and sunday nights. wednesday they played some old school hip hop and house music, sundays its all about house. the dating game has never been the main event for my night just a place to fall through for a lil bit, they do have some good chicken, i have always come here tipsy so i cant really judge their drinks but i wanna say they are good priced, the crowd is @ least 25+ all types of people with a lot of seating

1.description: Gwon Lee is another treasure of the Southeast Side, located just east of 87th Street and Stony Island Avenue.By now, we know that all Chinese is not the same -- and you and your stomach can distinguish that right away. I've eaten "five star restaurant" Chinese food and in takeout joints all over the world. Dish for dish, Gwon Lee is still the best Chinese I've ever eaten in my life. My family has been eating at this establishment, literally, for more than 30 years and it's as good now as when I was a child. This is traditional Chinese takeout at its finest. Fried rice browned to perfection and made with the freshest ingredients. Appetizers that are always good -- tender spareribs, crispy wontons, eggrolls and fried shrimp. After all these years I've tried everything on the menu and, truly, everything is good. But one of my favorites is this incredible fresh shrimp and egg with snap peas dish. To die for!Gwon Lee is old-school. Family owned, very small waiting area, cash only and they don't deliver. Incredibly reasonably priced. Best to call your order in ahead of time. If you live in the Calumet Heights/Burnside/South Chicago area, Gwon Lee is not to be missed, and for those who live outside of the community, it's worth the trip.

2.description: No. Just no. I wouldn't give them a star if I didn't have to. I ordered a large chicken fried rice, ONE piece of chicken in the entire container and it's dark meat. Never again.

0.description: Full disclosure: I was born and raised on the Southeast side and grew up eating this food.     The food here is made to be taken home and enjoyed. There are no tables here, and limited seating. The wood paneling on the East wall has been carved into so many times that your food will be ready before you have a chance to read it all. Most of the food here reheats very well and when I first bought my place, there were many times I bought large orders just so I'd have something quick to eat during the week.       That being said, the shrimp fried rice is my favorite fried rice on Earth up to this point.  The rice is well fried, maybe a little more than you're used to, but delicious.  They can even make it spicy. The egg foo young is delicious.  Be aware, this place specializes in basic Chinese food, so don't come here expecting that dish you saw them make on IRON CHEF.      In summary, Gwon Lee is not a fancy restaurant and will not provide you with a fine dining experience.  What Gwon Lee does is provide food that is inexpensive and delicious. Come here to grab a lunch special, or take a whole bunch home and eat it while you watch a movie. In a time where everything is so expensive, It's nice to have a place to go where you get good food, for a good price.

This CVS is way bigger then all the others one that I have visited in the past. Its your typical CVS with the pharmacies and medicine etc. My only complaint is that they can use more workers, because I don't want to walk around the whole store looking for help, but on the flip side, when you do find a worker they are usually friendly, so that helps. Over all I guess I am a fan of this place but I actually never really come here. oh well maybe I will start.

3.description: Typical establishment on the south side as opposed to a reputable chain. A coffee shop without wi-fi. Only certain hours the door is open, yet it's set in the neighborhood where people can walk. Advertised products not available. Slow, very slow service, doesn't matter how many people are working. Sandwiches are microwaved and therefor the bread is over cooked in some areas. I had a texas toast breakfast sandwich and the toast was clearly over microwaved. Ugj! And, friendly service? From a couple, others act as if they are doing you the favor. Avoid at all costs.

1.description: Go to get ice cream and the lazy worker have the lobby closed 45 minutes before closing. This is just bad business lazy workers always kill good businesses.  I went to another Donkin Donuts on 87th and Vernon much better workers

2.description: I have been to this location a lot. I am a dunkin donuts regular. Getting breakfast or coffee from this location was a disappointment one too many times. My hash browns were cold several times, stale or not cooked all the way. My iced coffee wasn't made properly. There were times it was too sweet and not enough coffee or coffee with no creamer and not enough sweetener. I took my drink back one time and they gave me the exact same one I returned. I will not be back to this location again. I will go to Starbucks.

0.description: This location is suitable when you need to eat something and you're right there. Within the past year I've started ordering the same exact thing from this location to ensure I didn't have any extra problems when I was trying to get to work in the morning. A couple times in a row this was a fail. One time I was too tired and yes I should have been paying attention, but I was overcharged. The next day I went in and demanded my money back with several receipts to prove that I get the exact same thing every time. Most of the staff looked at me crazy, so even though I don't really like confrontation I openly pointed out who rang me up that day and the person who usually rings me up. I got my money back then.It seems like one guy was so distracted looking at me he wasn't paying attention to the order I got that day smh. After this I went back one more time. Order the same thing, this time I was upset because after eating my sandwich, my drink was cold and tasted horrible. I was already waaayyys away from this location to turn around. I swear it had to be the wrong drink all together. I knew they messed up because usually driving from that location, by the time I get around the Museum of Science and Industry my drink is still hot and ready. I decided to stop torturing myself. I now just make my own breakfast in a timely fashion, or load my Starbucks card and head there. Also, Subway around the corner is open 24 hours and has fresher and healthier breakfast options. :-)

3.description: Professional, personable, and the best lashes! Yetta consistently does a fantastic job that will have you/your lashes looking gorgeous. I've gotten so many comments and compliments on my lashes. Parking is free, scheduling appointments is quick & easy, and she does a quick and phenomenal job.

1.description: Go to Yetta! She is the best, it was my first time getting legit  eyelash extensions, (not including the places you go to get glue and lashes on your skin!) and I couldn't be anymore pleased with my now 2 experiences here. Yetta made me feel comfortable and didn't pressure me into getting something I didn't want or need, her prices are definitely reasonable for the quality you're getting. I am the first person to complain when it comes to my eyes if something doesn't feel right and I was surprised how that was not an issue here from your appointment until it's time for a refill I haven't had any issues. The new location is easy to get to and didn't have any problems finding parking. I will definitely be a regular here!

2.description: Yetta is the gem - I've had lash extension in a number of places and this is one that I keep returning to. Although I've always loved the results, Yetta is one that I would recommend because her extension lasts better and does not destroy my eyelash (i.e. when the extension falls off, they don't bring my lashes with them!). Her prices are very reasonable, and is easy to book via styleseat.

9.description: "Yetta is so friendly!!!! The bonus is she makes my eyelashes look fabulous!! So natural too! My closest friends can't tell what I've had done yet notice there's something different about me! LOL! When I do finally say what it is they can't believe those aren't my lashes. Yetta you are the best! So relaxing too! I always fall asleep while she's doing my lashes. "

10.description: I came here right when it opened after going else where and received a terrible eye infection. I loved the way they looked for the first couple of hours that I decided maybe it was the place and not the actual eyelash extensions. When I met Yetta she had this vibe about her that makes you feel so loved in her presence and I love that she's in charge of everything and there's no talking to a bunch of people that all tell you different things! She sticks to her word and I am always more than pleased walking out of my appointment!

4.description: Love this place! If you want high quality professional grade lash extensions with the service to match, this is where you go. Yetta is always accommodating to the personal needs of her customers. I've been going here for almost a year and always walk out with an amazing customized set of lashes. I've tried out a couple of other places including Chicago lashes and they don't event come close to comparing. She takes great care to give you the look you want every time, customizing it to your standards. Try doing that at a salon and they'll just wedge you into the "Kim k" or "natural" look category. Nothing exciting about that! If you're reading these reviews and are trying to decide which lash salon to go to, you've found the answer at Lash Luxe!

6.description: Loved Yetta! So friendly and easy to talk too. Answers all your questions beforehand and even during. Super knowledgeable, you can tell she really loves what she does.  Will be back!

12.description: The place must be phenomenal, I'll say it plain and simple I think my better half is beautiful naturally, however I know when she's all smiles and giggles after one of her many "errands" it's generally because she is more than pleased by putting one over on me.I kept telling her how amazing she looked and she finally spilled it. She went on ranting and raving that she had never had better work done and she knows her stuff when it comes to beauty. I know she would have never told me about the lashes since she knows I am not a fan of anything that looks too artificial however since they look amazing and natural  I'm signing her up as a lifetime client. Thanks Lash Luxe , nothing like a woman beaming because she looks beautiful.

5.description: As a male, walking in a women's salon can be intimidating, but Yetta made me feel super welcomed and relaxed. She explained the process, and what would fit me better in order to no look  "drag queen" like. Lol! :) I laid face up, and the hour just flew by talking to Yetta non stop. She is so approachable, and personable. Trust me, you will walk out with not only anew lash stylist, if that is even a term used, but a new friend! :)

13.description: I agree with all of the compliments for Yetta.  She is professional, experienced, and pleasant.  Her prices are reasonable and she does quality work.  I visited her after having a poor quality job done elsewhere.

11.description: I really never make reviews , but here I go! I was soooooo happy with my lashes! She was very professional & takes her time setting the individual lashes. The outcome was so beautiful and I was extremely pleased! I had a bad experience elsewhere, thankfully the technician was able to remove the previous lashes, she even gave them a nice protein treatment! I came back a month after and she set some wonderful good quality lashes just in time for my birthday! Highly recommended! I will be coming back.

8.description: One word : Professional ! It's so hard to find a business owner that up holds that quality on top of excellent service. I'm beyond picky when it comes to sanitation , especially dealing with something as sensitive as my eyes . Cleanliness is everything, and this place is immaculate ! Not only did I feel comfortable , I actually felt that Yetta listened to what I wanted. I hate the strip lash bulky look, and I definitely didn't get that. All natural individual lashes  ! And I have gotten so many compliments from everyone . I will never go back to any lash salon/tech ever . It's all about that personal touch that I received , can't get that anywhere else .

0.description: I am so happy that I found LashLuxe and Yetta here on Yelp!A few weeks ago I was in Miami and treated myself to a full-set of lash extensions.Of course when I came back to Chicago I had to find a place that would do the full-ins.  I expected to have to go Downtown or Lincoln Park, but I found Lash Luxe in the Irving Park/Milwaukee area, also known as "6 Corners." Yetta's reviews were great, and the location is so easy to get to, and there is lots of street/metered parking. All of the stars were in alignment, so I thought I'd give it a try!!I have my new lashes, Yetta is a doll and a real pro at eyelashes, and the shop is lovely!! Her area is very comfortable, and we chatted through the whole appointment as though we'd known each other forever!! And I have lashes!!I wake up, and I'm already made-up with these long, luxurious lashes in place.I made my next appointment before I left.Lashes, a nearby Starbucks, a few blocks from the Kennedy, a fun appointment, and easy parking???You can't go wrong!!

7.description: Yetta is awesome! I have gone to her a few times now and she is the best. She is very knowledgeable and answers all of your questions. Making you very comfortable with the process. She does a fantastic job with the application of the lashes, highly recommend!

1.description: I LOVE the Browtique ! very professional and friendly staff, plus my brows look amazing :)

9.description: Never would have thought an eyebrow waxing could be relaxing!! It was painless and actually enjoyable! My eyebrows needed some serious shaping after years of $10 wax jobs at nail salons etc. Stephanie did a phenomenal job! The only thing keeping me from giving all 5 stars is the price increase to $40 (worth it but def won't be able to come in as often as I'd like at that price) and having to book appointments so far in advance. Sometimes things come up and I find myself in need of a last minute wax....But overall you can't beat the quality! I will definitely be back.

12.description: Diana did an AMAZING job on my eyebrows. She is a perfectionist, she's very knowledgable and I will be coming back.

21.description: Diana is awesome at brows, I will go to her as long as she is in business. She is very accommodating to my awful schedule. Bottom line, have her sculpt your brows and you will be very happy with the results!

16.description: A trip to the Browtique will transform your appearance. This dynamic duo have a modern shop that is clean and elegant. Excellent service and painless brow wax. Highly recommend! Thank you, Diana and Stefanie.

17.description: I have been to both Diana and Stefanie they are amazing! My eyebrows have never looked so good. I will be a customer for a very long time!

10.description: I was referred to the Browtique by a friend and decided to try them out. Diana did an excellent job on my eyebrows and she really takes her time. I let my eyebrows grow out for about 3 weeks and Diana did a great job shaping them and added an arch. We had great conversation and she is very pleasant. The prices are higher than my usual threading place but you pay for the service and technique. I will definitely be going back.

5.description: Stephanie is excellent!! Cannot recommend this place enough! I am highly satisfied with my eyebrows. After years of getting them threaded, I was tired of the inconsistent results from different threaders. Stephanie is an expert. I will never trust anyone else with my eyebrows from now on! Highly recommend the Browtique. Worth every penny!

11.description: I just had my appointment today with Diana, and she did a great job! After growing them out for a couple weeks, I am in love with my brows. She waxed them, plucked some strays, and showed me how to fill them in. Thanksomuch!

22.description: Diana is amazing!  I had a horrible experience once with my eyebrows and vowed never to have them touched again.....until I found Diana!  I will never go anywhere else to get my brows done.  She does a fantastic job and she is very friendly.  The salon is really cute and the prices are very reasonable.Really, I can't say enough good things about The Browtique!  You won't be disappointed.

0.description: Love love this place,  yes it's hard to find next available appointment but that tells you how  good the girls are.  Yes it is a lot of money but worth every penny.  No preference as of which girl they both do outstanding job.

20.description: Love her. I foresee adding her to my monthly budget for a long time.

2.description: Cute place and the estheticians there know what they are doing. My eyebrows came out great. I  took away a star due to price - way too expensive. I won't be going as often as I would like to get my eyebrows done. Also, it is difficult to get in for an appointment. I like using their online booking system, but there are only three girls that work there and the next available appointment is in a month.***This is an update. I have been here twice and like I mentioned early that it is difficult to get an appointment, and now it has gotten worse. It is October 25th and the next available appointment is December 31st! That is ridiculous. Unfortunately, I will need to find another place. My best friend, who goes there too, is looking for another place too.***

18.description: Diana is simply a magician. For years I kept hearing, you have to grow this in, your brows are too thin, blah blah.... Well thanks to Diana I now have two brows with arches.  You rock!!!

13.description: Hadn't had my eyebrows done in years. Wanted to give them some shape for my upcoming wedding. Stephanie did an excellent job! I was a little scared at first but my eyebrows have never looked better. She also suggested a tint which totally made them stand out. I also received the Essence facial afterwards. I am 46 years old and my skin has never looked better. She uses tried and true products with an excellent technique. I left with no make-up on and thought I looked great, my skin tone was even and glowing but not red. It was a wonderful experience and I will definitely be back. Thanks Stephanie!!!

4.description: Literally the best service by Stefanie ever! She's the most kind down to earth person and does an AMAZING job on the brows! I'd recommend her to anyone. Obsessed with this place!!!

6.description: I have been coming to The Browtique since 2012. Diana does an AMAZING job!!! I can't recommend this place enough!!! If you want perfection, this is definitely the place to go!!!

15.description: Diana is amazing!  I had a horrible experience once with my eyebrows and vowed never to have them touched again.....until I found Diana!  I will never go anywhere else to get my brows done.  She does a fantastic job and she is very friendly.  The salon is really cute and the prices are very reasonable.Really, I can't say enough good things about The Browtique!  You won't be disappointed.

7.description: AMAZING! You won't regret going to The Browtique. I love eyebrow day, because each time I go (about every 4-5 weeks) my eyebrows get better and better. Stefanie is such a down-to-earth person, very nice, professional, and she makes you feel very comfortable, like you're visiting a friend. She takes her time and is a perfectionist. And, I love the education she provides; how to shade, pencil, and highlight. My brows have never looked better!

8.description: Diana has been doing my eyebrows for almost a decade and there is a very good reason for that! She is the brow guru and I no longer trust anyone else with my eyebrows because she is such a perfectionist. She and her partner Stefanie are super friendly and professional. The shop is always clean and well-organized. You will NOT regret your visit to The Browtique!

3.description: I can't say enough good things about The Browtique. These girls are so professional, sweet, kind and TALENTED! The shop is beautifully decorated, clean, and inviting. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Diana and Stefanie, in my opinion, are brow guru's.  I will never allow anyone else to touch my brows again! If you want to walk away from your waxing appointment feeling wonderful EVERY.SINGLE.TIME this is where you need to go! You will not miss out!

14.description: I spent about 5 months growing out my eyebrows after I walked out of a salon with what seemed like 10 hairs left per brow.  I did a bunch of research before I decided to try The Browtique.  The Browtique located in the Sola Salon Studios.  It is basically a bunch of individual salon suites a number of beauty professionals use to run their own businesses. The first time I saw Diana she really took her time sculpting my brows.  I knew I still had some growing in to do, but Diana used a brow pencil to show me the brows I could eventually have if I was patient and let her deal with them.I went in for my second appointment a few days ago and I couldn't be happier with the results.  My whole face looks better.  I won't trust anyone else with my eyebrows from now on.Diana is professional, and promptly responds to phone calls and texts for appointments.  Her prices are more than reasonable.  Thanks Diana!

3.description: I had thin crust pizza , crust was very dry like a cracker with no flavor . Other than that it's ok , I wouldn't drive a long way to get there for a pizza ..... I did go back yesterday and turkey sausage pizza was quite good and on line ordering helps.

1.description: Yes! Two stars only, the service was ok but the PIZZA...yuck! No flavor at all the crust fell apart and there was no herbs or anything that screams pizza! The sausage was flavorless and had chewy fat inside,  thick pasty nasty sauce the fresh mushrooms were good that's it! I will stick with the beef sandwich here which is worth a try...i don't see why anyone would like this tasteless pizza!

2.description: The food here is delicious, the rib tips are huge, please see the pic to believe. The fettuccine is amazing, there is a real chef in this kitchen, not a random person for sure. Please try them out you will not be disappointed. Food was delivered hot and fresh. I will definitely order again.

5.description: The pizza was very tasty and delicious to the taste buds! I had ordered a delicious large Supreme pizza that had sausage, thick cheese, fresh mushrooms, green peppers and light on the onions that was just right! It was quite filling!

6.description: Great pizza and the estimated pick up time is always accurate.  Thin crust is our favorite and it's cheesy and hot. Ask for fresh garlic on whatever pizza combination you get - it will change your world.

7.description: I have ordered from here 2-3 times in the last 12 to 18 months. We usually order pizzas; once, I ordered an Italian Beef and a Calzone. The pizzas are usually fair to good. Packed with toppings and overflowing with cheese. Could use less sauce because the toppings sometimes slide off or the crust is a little soggy. But not so much as it is a deal breaker. The calzone was ok; not a lot of flavor, too much dough. The Italian Beef was not your typical Chicago-style Beef. The meat and bread were too dry; there was not enough meat, they put the peppers on the side, and the cheese was processed. Overall it is an ok place, and hey, please remember not too many pizza places deliver on the Southside.

8.description: Good pizza but better when u get extra sauce. Its a bit dry without the extra.

0.description: The home made pizza puff is great!!! And you can pick your own toppings too!! Fires were ok. I'llBe calling to try more of there menu that's for sure!!

4.description: I order a small meaty thin crust pizza and a soft drink.  The pizza was good and hot, but customer service was lacking no greeting.

3.description: Restaurant is a diamond in the rough. The food is really good and the restaurant is clean.  I've had the chicken alfredo, southwestern chicken wrap, chicken on a croissant, and the blackened tilipia.  Each dish was flavorful and tasty. I live no where near this restaurant but I drive the distance to eat here.

1.description: I'll say a 3.5 star suites them well. Ok here's the deal it's on 87th and Stony Island keep your eyes open because the store sign is small and you will miss it. I ordered the chicken and shrimp Alfredo. It came with some garlic bread on the side. If your hungry get ready to eat, because the portion size was huge. I split it with my man and we still had more for later. Saucy, cheesy, and loaded with chicken and shrimp. But it didn't really taste like Alfredo pasta.. Idk.. It was still good but it didn't taste like traditional Alfredo sauce. But it was hot and ready within 10mins. I'll go back to try the blackened catfish and also the jambalaya.

2.description: I ordered the Chicken Fajita Salad. Great flavor, yet they could use a low sodium fajita seasoning and hold the cheddar cheese (ask if you want it). The fried tortilla strips were delicious.

5.description: Finally tried this restaurant and I enjoyed the food. Inside was very clean. Ordered Red potatoes, chicken shrimp fettuccine and Jambalaya. The jambalaya us spicy but very flavorful. Wished they cooked the veggies a little longer they were very crisp. Fettuccine had a great taste but was a little oily. Will try again in want to try the wraps not far from home.

6.description: This place is a gem for the neighborhood. Reasonable prices and good healthy food. There are new cooks so I believe the low star reviews have come because of them because when the owner use to be the only cook there were never any bad reviews.

7.description: I have been there for dessert only. I have been there twice and they haven't had caramal cake. One day I went in the evening and the next time was in the morning. I have also called midday and still no caramel cake. This makes me wonder if they actually serve it. I gave it two stars because the red velvet cake was good.

0.description: Tried sizzlin grille as I love to patron neighborhood businesses. Food was amazing, I ordered the jambalaya and the southwest chicken wrap. The jambalaya was spicy but full of flavor. The chicken wrap was really good, my boyfriend even liked it and wanted to take my food! Staff was nice and friendly. Please try them, this is a nice place in the community.

4.description: tried this place b/c I had a groupon and always looking for options near the office. Clean enviro. TV and jazz music battling it out to drown out the cashier. Service is terribly slow. Took 25 minutes at 1:30 on a Thursday afternoon to get a wrap and a fettuccine. Not exaggerating. Even worse, both dishes were over-seasoned with the same seasonings. Screwed up another customers order while I was waiting my 25 mins to get my food. I'm all about locally owned businesses, but I will NOT recommend this place. Really needs improvement if they are going to succeed.

3.description: This isn't the biggest CVS in town but I have found the staff to be amazing!I haven't stepped inside of this place once and not been greeted with a smile when I check out!If I'm not sure where something is I have been taken right to the aisle!  That doesn't mean I haven't encountered a pointer, you know the one that says yes right in aisle 4 and you still don't see the item.This is one of my favorite CVS stores and I will be back!SN: I love the after Halloween Candy Sale you always can find the best chocolates for more than 50% off!

1.description: This CVS is okay. I don't really have any complaints about it. They keep the store neat and clean. It's pretty much the same as any other CVS.

2.description: I HATE going into this CVS, however this time it could not be avoided. I uploaded some pictures to the CVS  website for pick up the following day- I was given the time of 11am. These pictures were to be viewed at my great aunt's memorial, these pictures were sentimental. well, i go there (close to 1pm), grab some powder (hey, it's hot!) and let the gentleman know I also have some pictures to pick up. He goes to look for the pictures and states "She will help you, I can't find them". Who "she" was, i didn't know. I find a seat, and I sit. I then get up, and ask "does 'she' know I am waiting?" he said she did. Well "she" finally comes to assist. Asks me when I sent my pictures to be printed, I said last night. she then goes to computer and nonchalantly says "i am printing them for you right now". WTF?! What is the point of doing this online, if you don't print them until I arrive?? The pictures come out of the printer... here are my issues:1. They were dark2. I uploaded 8 pictures, she only printed 63. The pictures were also blurry. "Courtney"- (that was her name). let me know that if they were from a phone they could come out blurry. They were from a camera, and did not look like that when they were uploaded. 4. She did not apologize or acknowledge that I had to sit and wait for some pictures that I sent to their website LAST NIGHT for pickup that were not ready. 5. I also mentioned to her that there were 8 pictures, and I only received 6. She said nothing. This CVS is THE WORST, there is always a line. The people behind the counter are so ghetto and awful. And there is almost always someone outside begging. Please avoid at all costs.

0.description: Who writes reviews on the neighborhood pharmacy?  Someone who is happy with the store, that's who.  I give this store 4 stars because thay always have the hair dye I want and they always take my coupons.  There is no limit on how many I can use here.  If it scans, they take it.  Love it.  Minus 1 star because there is always a line.  Even if there is not one when I walk in, there is a long one by the time I get ready to leave.  Every.  Single.  Time.

4.description: I'm rating CVS for exactly what they are....a pharmacy. For years now I have had to make serious use of a pharmacy. It wasn't until I started getting my prescriptions here that I felt comfortable. I finally found my one place that I can go to for my prescriptions. The pharmacy staff is great. They always answer any of my crazy questions I have about a medication or anything. They are always friendly! That's very important. I've dealt with them over the phone, in the store and in the drive-thru. Same great service all across the board. They also just helped me have hundreds on a recent medication. For that alone they have my loyalty!

3.description: You want good food  and great customer service? 'Wingz It Is' is a terrific choice! Nice crunchy chicken  with a variety of flavors to choose from that will satisfy anyone's taste buds. Tilapia  is pretty good to. Not to mention the fries are the bomb . Very reasonable prices and very customer friendly. My family loves this place. I would recommend this place to anybody!!!! Uhmm mmmm good

1.description: Everything is made to order which is great but I was expecting something else. I was looking to get a fried wing smothered in some type of sauce like traditional buffalo or teriyaki wings. What I got was a fried wing with seasoning sprinkled on top of it. The mild sauce was a disgrace to Chicago's Mild sauce as it was just a spicy barbecue sauce. However now that I know what to expect I would visit again as the wings were fried to perfection, really crispy with a fluffiness to them.

2.description: Ok,Honestly I chose this place, because the pricing was cheap! I called in to place an order of 100 wings and I was honestly extremely undecided. The young man who answered the phone was sooooooooooooo patient I kept apologizing and he kept saying not needed. Finally I decided to do 25 garlic, 25 Mild and 75 Plain. These wings were GREAT! The Garlic wings are truly something special I just cant believe I just found this place. I am writing this review to say you don't have to be at a fancy location to get 5 star quality and service.

5.description: Honestly this was one of my favorite places to go. After today I would never step foot in this establishment again. I purchased to orders of wings.  After my 20 minute drive home I discover the wings are so little there's barely room for error in their preparation. Once I bit into them it was like chewing a potato chip. I then called to speak with the manager he wasn't there. So the person who answered asked how can I help. I began to explain he interrupted to say "he knew so he told" that's where I stopped him to explain let me finish. I explained I'm not looking for a refund and no I don't want any more food. So apparently I may have cursed in my explanation and he acted as if I cursed at him and began to get louder. Now I may have said a word or two I really don't recall but in no way did I direct this at him I was simply giving my discretion of the food. As well as letting him know I understand you can't pick the size of the wing and I realized they tried to put in more. But the cook should know better than to cook wings of that size the same amount of time as larger ones. When the meat on the outside is just as hard as the inside there's a problem.  So he began to talk as if I had completely cursed him out and speak I'll of him which at $18 for wings that were garbage maybe u should have been. I let him know ofcourse if i used a curse in my description and he was offended I'm sorry. But there was no need for him to say anything defensive my call was to inform them of my disappointment in what had been served. I for one held this place to a different standard than the average wing joint and this food was unacceptable and no need for an apology or offer of more food. After this phone call I won't be spending my money here again.

0.description: Great customer service. The garlic seasoned wings are my favorite.  I also like the wedges. Called my order in and it was ready when I got there.

4.description: I've been here about 5 times and I must say the wings here are fantastic! I always get the BBQ wings and have them put garlic in it too. Our orders have always been correct, hot, and delicious. The staff here is pretty friendly too, and I've never seen it crowded which is a plus. If you walk in and order expect to wait 15 minutes. Call in if you're in a rush or don't feel like waiting.Did I mention their banana pudding? It's AWESOME and it's only $2.50! Definitely worth a shot if you like banana pudding.

3.description: Like most things. "its not what it used to be". At one point they had the best gyros and italian beef. Not anymore. The last time I was there. I got a peewee burger with heavy pickle. They charged me extra for the pickles. When I asked why, the guy said because of the cost related to high quality pickles. When I got the burger, the pickles were of the jewel brand jar pickles.  Haven't been back. The fries are horrible! I've never liked their fries.

1.description: This place is amazing! Favorite restaurant don't know where to start everything I've ordered from here is delicious. I would highly recommend this place if you never ate here before.

2.description: It was a great place a few years ago , the gyro was good I had today but the place has gone down the floor is messed up and menu is apparently paper taped over the old sign .

0.description: This is a neighborhood fast food spot that has been around for years and has transferred honorship several times. I mainly opt for the chicken on pita with fries, but I have also had the pizza puff. Both very standard fast food options, nothing spectacular. They close fairly early during the week - around 9pm.

4.description: Another dive that is not as bad as it seems... gyros are not bad

1.description: I went here due to a recommendation and wish I hadn't. I ordered chicken teriyaki and was given "beef teriyaki" which was more like beef and broccoli but it was GROSS. My boyfriend's beef fried rice was good, and he got chicken too that was still pink. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

2.description: If I could give it 0 stars I would. The food sucked, which is hard for me cause I can eat anything, but when you order chicken wings and it's raging pink inside? It's time to wrap up it. The only good about this place is the fact that you can play lotto besides that? It blows custard.

0.description: I always order the same thing it's great every time . Fast friendly staff ,cash only , you can call ahead for pickup

3.description: This is the deep south, baby. The deep South Side, that is. Check out the address, which cracks me up: 9273 S. South Chicago Ave. South South Chicago Avenue, and it's not even redundant.We stopped into the bar to relax after we walked from Calumet Fisheries (see review by the same name).There was a FAT lady smoking a cigarette when we arrived. Blech. And when she left, a guy went to the slot machines two at a time, which was God-awful; imagine: two slot machines played simultaneously with Chuck E Cheeses musical motif.The Corona's were $3.50, so that was nice. The Mexican motel art was cheeseball, and we never did venture next door to see the restaurant. Just an any-port-in-the-storm joint for a beer before making our way through Customs and Immigration.

1.description: Very good food but the service here is horrible. They have 1 waitress and it took a long time for her to attend every table. She was very nice, not rude at all as some waitresses can be but I dont think ill be coming back unless they have more help.

2.description: Don't let the last review of this place scare you. The bar side if this joint is definitely Sketch Central. The restaurant, however, is a DIAMOND IN THE ROUGH!Clean. Friendly. And overall pretty good food for decent prices. Fresh two. Roma's prepares everything with only the best ingredients and produce. Their classic American diner food is super yummy. Think burgers with thick, juicy patties and steak fries. THE BEST GRILLED CHICKEN SANDWICH in SOUTH CHICAGO. And turkey club sandwiches that don't skimp on the turkey, tomato, lettuce, and mayo.Their Italian food also gets a B+ in my book. Minestrone is super hearty and filled with tons of different veggies. Try their lemon chicken pasta. Their calamari and bruschetta are also excellent.Daily soup specials! Thursday is the best day...where else can you find CREAM OF RED BELL PEPPER SOUP?! yummmm! Can't beat that with their fresh baked bread they give to EVERY customer, even take out customers! Family owned business! Mike, the owner, is an AWESOME guy and super funny. Make sure you check out the picture of him and Mayor Daley behind the register (YES, the mayor ate here!)Breakfast here is also delicious. Their pancakes give IHOP a run for thier money. Try the breakfast special for $4.99! You get two pancakes, two slices of bacon, eggs any way, and two sausage links! That's a million times better than a McDonald's breakfast!Careful, their hours change in the winter and they usually close around 5 or 6! Also, feel free to park in the Bank of America parking lot next door. Mike worked some kind of deal out with the bank so that his customers can park there! Yay!

0.description: Great tacos!!!!  Service is great they r friendly and the restaurant is clean!!!                                  Also try their garlic shrimp !!!!!!!!!

4.description: This place has great breakfast and a nice bar for those mornings you need something extra. notable items on the menu are the breakfast skillets and the pancakes. Don't get too fancy with your drinks, a simple rum & coke, beer, or vodka and lemonade is your best bet.Both the restaurant and bar are always clean, the waiters are friendly and very attentive.
